resources.string: Travelers can find both traditional restaurants serving typical Antioquian food such as bandeja paisa, sancocho, and tamales, as well as more sophisticated establishments with gourmet offerings.
Carmen de Viboral offers a variety of lodging options for different needs and budgets. There are also family inns and cabins that allow you to enjoy nature and local traditions at a good price.

Carmen de Viboral is a town in the department of Antioquia, Colombia. It is located 78 km from Medell√≠n. It has around 40,000 inhabitants and an area of 290 km2. It is at an altitude of 2,140 meters above sea level, so it has a cold climate. The economy is mainly based on agriculture, with crops such as coffee, plantain, sugarcane, beans, and corn. There is also manufacturing industry and handicrafts.
